title: Guess the Roman Rule
prompt: In a mysterious manuscript, the following pairs appear: 3 → III, 9 → IX, 14 → XIV. Explain the rule and write the Roman numeral for 19.
hints: Look at where small symbols appear before large ones.
Focus on how 9 and 14 are built from 10, 5, and 1.
solution_explanation: Roman numerals normally write large symbols first, but a smaller symbol before a larger one means subtraction. 19 is 10 + 9, written as XIX.

title: Stacked Dots and Bars
prompt: You see a two-level Mayan numeral: top: —• (one bar and one dot), bottom: —•• (one bar and two dots). Using base-20 logic, what Arabic number is this?
hints: Convert each level to a digit 0–19.
